DataType.Name: Rank
DataType.Comment: Current priority level (Priority on low number)

DataType.Name: Sensor_Lock
DataType.Comment: External sensor detection locked by a sensor

DataType.Name: Color
DataType.Comment: Chose the color of the light

DataType.Name: Effect
DataType.Comment: Chose the status of the light

DataType.Name: Ready
DataType.Comment: Flash lamp is ready to work

DataType.Name: Fault
DataType.Comment: Flash lamp can't display the command

DataType.Name: Commissioning
DataType.Comment: Flash lamp is in commissioning mode

DataType.Name: LevelMode
DataType.Comment: Flash lamp is in level mode

DataType.Name: Rank
DataType.Comment: Current priority level (Priority on low number)

DataType.Name: Output
DataType.Comment: "Coil" order. If coil is OFF, cylinder is inside, if ON, cylinder is outside

DataType.Name: SingleActing
DataType.Comment: Single-acting cylinders with one input to go OUT, and a spring to return IN

DataType.Name: DoubleActing
DataType.Comment: Double-acting cylinders use the force of air to move

DataType.Name: AsSensorOut
DataType.Comment: Cylinder is equiped with OUT position sensor

DataType.Name: AsSensorIn
DataType.Comment: Cylinder is equiped with IN position sensor

DataType.Name: SensorOut
DataType.Comment: Sensor feedback for cylinder is in position OUT

DataType.Name: SensorIn
DataType.Comment: Sensor feedback for cylinder is in position IN

DataType.Name: TimeoutGoIn
DataType.Comment: Cylinder spend too much time to go in IN position

DataType.Name: TimeoutGoOut
DataType.Comment: Cylinder spend too much time to go in OUT position

DataType.Name: TooMuchConfig
DataType.Comment: Cylinder has more than one configuration bloc

DataType.Name: TooMuchConfig
DataType.Comment: Vibrator has more than one configuration bloc

DataType.Name: Overload
DataType.Comment: More then one manager are instantiated

DataType.Name: ShortCircuit
DataType.Comment: More then one manager are instantiated

DataType.Name: OverVoltage
DataType.Comment: More then one manager are instantiated

DataType.Name: CurrentSpike
DataType.Comment: More then one manager are instantiated

DataType.Name: SensorFault
DataType.Comment: More then one manager are instantiated

DataType.Name: Done
DataType.Comment: Handshake of done given by a function

DataType.Name: Value
DataType.Comment: Value to write in the parameter code

DataType.Name: TempTooHot_Overall
DataType.Comment: The machine or part of the machine is too hot

DataType.Name: TempTooCold_Overall
DataType.Comment: The machine or part of the machine is too cold

DataType.Name: IsClearing
DataType.Comment: Clearing state : Initiated by a state command to clear faults that may have occurred when

DataType.Name: IsStopped
DataType.Comment: Stopped state : The machine is powered and stationary after completing the STOPPING state

DataType.Name: IsStarting
DataType.Comment: Starting state : This state is entered as a result of a STARTING command

DataType.Name: IsSuspended
DataType.Comment: Machine is suspended from EXECUTE state

DataType.Name: IsStopping
DataType.Comment: Transition state between from Ready and STOPPED

DataType.Name: IsAborting
DataType.Comment: Transition state between from Work and ABORTED

DataType.Name: IsHolding
DataType.Comment: Transition state between EXECUTE and HELD

DataType.Name: IsHeld
DataType.Comment: Machine is held from EXECUTE state

DataType.Name: IsUnHolding
DataType.Comment: Transition state between HELD and EXECUTE

DataType.Name: IsSuspending
DataType.Comment: Transition state between EXECUTE and SUSPENDED

DataType.Name: IsUnSuspending
DataType.Comment: Transition state between SUSPENDED and EXECUTE

DataType.Name: IsResetting
DataType.Comment: Transition state between STOPPED and IDLE

DataType.Name: IsCompleting
DataType.Comment: Transition state between EXECUTE and COMPLETED

DataType.Name: Reset
DataType.Comment: Order to change state from Stopped to IDLE

DataType.Name: Start
DataType.Comment: Order to change state from IDLE to Execute

DataType.Name: Stop
DataType.Comment: Order to change state to Stopped

DataType.Name: Hold
DataType.Comment: Order to change state from Execute to Held

DataType.Name: UnHold
DataType.Comment: Order to change state from Held to Execute

DataType.Name: Suspend
DataType.Comment: Order to change state from Execute to Suspended

DataType.Name: UnSuspend
DataType.Comment: Order to change state from Suspended to Execute

DataType.Name: Complete
DataType.Comment: Order to change state from Execute to Completed

DataType.Name: Abort
DataType.Comment: Order to change state to Aborted

DataType.Name: Clear
DataType.Comment: Order to change state from Aborted to Stopped

DataType.Name: Color
DataType.Comment: Chose the color of the status

DataType.Name: Cannot_Init
DataType.Comment: Machine is stopped but can't initialize

DataType.Name: Can_Init
DataType.Comment: Machine is stopped and can initialize

DataType.Name: PneuUp_NoAir
DataType.Comment: Machine is stopped, pneumatic activated but no air

DataType.Name: ClipAnalyze
DataType.Comment: Machine is ready to start, first 20 clips will be skipped in order to analyze the next 20

DataType.Name: DoorOpen
DataType.Comment: Machine is ready to start when door closed or bypass activated

DataType.Name: Executing
DataType.Comment: Machine is in execute (can't name this one "execute")

DataType.Name: IsHolding
DataType.Comment: Machine is preparing to be helded

DataType.Name: IsHeld
DataType.Comment: Machine is Held - Intervention can be made

DataType.Name: IsUnHolding
DataType.Comment: Machine is exiting the state of held and preparing to get back to running

DataType.Name: IsSuspending
DataType.Comment: Machine is in the procces of being paused

DataType.Name: IsSuspended
DataType.Comment: Machine is in paused - in this state we do not reset everything

DataType.Name: UnSupending
DataType.Comment: Machine is in the process to get back to running

DataType.Name: IsCompleting
DataType.Comment: Machine is processing the end of the work before stopping

DataType.Name: NextStep
DataType.Comment: Machine is in semi automatic and waiting to activate next step

DataType.Name: RessourceName
DataType.Comment: Result which will be shown of the HMI

DataType.Name: OrderWaiting
DataType.Comment: We want to add an enum but the rank is lower than the one which is currently on

DataType.Name: Rank
DataType.Comment: Current priority level (Priority on low number)

DataType.Name: Value
DataType.Comment: enumeration of the state of machine, more specific

DataType.Name: Clearing
DataType.Comment: The procedural element has received a command to clear faults that may have occurred when ABORTING, and are present in the ABORTED state before proceeding to a STOPPED state

DataType.Name: Stopped
DataType.Comment: The machine is powered and stationary. All communications with other systems are functioning

DataType.Name: Starting
DataType.Comment: This state provides the steps needed to start the machine and is a result of a starting type command. Following this command the machine will begin to “execute”.

DataType.Name: Idle
DataType.Comment: This is a State which indicates that RESETING is complete. This state maintains the machine conditions which were achieved during the RESET state.

DataType.Name: Suspended
DataType.Comment: The machine may be running at the relevant setpoint speed, there is no product being produced. This state can be reached as a result of a machine status, and differs from HELD in that HELD is typically a result of an operator request

DataType.Name: Execute
DataType.Comment: Once the machine is processing materials it is deemed to be Executing or in the EXECUTE state. Execute refers to the mode in which the machine is in.

DataType.Name: Stopping
DataType.Comment: This state executes the logic which brings the machine to a controlled and safe stop

DataType.Name: Aborting
DataType.Comment: The ABORTED state can be entered at any time in response to the Abort command or on the occurrence of a machine fault.

DataType.Name: Aborted
DataType.Comment: This state maintains machine status information relevant to the Abort condition. The Stop command will force transition to the Stopped state

DataType.Name: Holding
DataType.Comment: When the machine is in the EXECUTE state the Hold command can be used to start HOLDING logic which brings the machine to a controlled stop or to a state which represents HELD for the particular machine mode.

DataType.Name: Held
DataType.Comment: The HELD state would typically be used by the operator to hold the temporarily hold the machine's operation whilst material blockages are cleared, or to stop throughput whilst a downstream problem is resolved.

DataType.Name: Unholding
DataType.Comment: The UNHOLDING state is typically a response to an operator command to resume EXECUTE state. UNHOLDING prepares the machine to re-enter the EXECUTE state.

DataType.Name: Suspending
DataType.Comment: This state is a result of a command change from the EXECUTE state. This state is typically required prior to the SUSPENDED wait state, and prepares the machine (ie stops glue cycles, stops carton feeds, etc) prior to the SUSPEND state.

DataType.Name: Unsuspending
DataType.Comment: This state is a result of a request from SUSPENDED state to go back to the EXECUTE state. This state is done prior to EXECUTE state, and prepares the machine for the EXECUTE state.

DataType.Name: Resetting
DataType.Comment: This element is the result of a RESET command from the STOPPED state. RESETTING will typically cause a machine to sound a horn and place the machine in a state where components are energized awaiting a START command

DataType.Name: Completing
DataType.Comment: When the machine is in the EXECUTE state the Complete command can be used to start COMPLETED logic which brings the machine to a controlled stop

DataType.Name: Completed
DataType.Comment: The machine has finished the COMPLETING state and is now waiting for a STOP command that will cause a transition to the STOPPED state
